radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild concentric left ventricular hypertrophy with normal cavity size and normal regional-global systolic function (ejection fraction, >60%); peak gradient across the aortic valve was 97 mm Hg; calculated aortic valve area of 0.7 cm2; no aortic regurgitation; mild mitral regurgitation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Peak gradient increased from 67 mm Hg to 97 mm Hg between August 2008 and January 2009.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Peak gradient was 67 mm Hg and calculated aortic valve area of 0.7 cm2.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Demonstrated an increase in peak gradient from 67 mm Hg in August 2008 to 97 mm Hg in January 2009.

radiographic_examinations.findings: The study was stopped early due to fatigue; hypotension was observed during the test; interpreted as probably normal myocardial perfusion.
